summary: This document is an NCIC (National Crime Information Center) delayed response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to the FBI New York Field Office. It provides the result of a search for a protection order record related to the Epstein case, specifically noting the record is expired and warning against any action based solely on it.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: He is listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the agency providing the NCIC response.

events.title: NCIC Protection Order Inquiry Response
events.description: The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services responds to an FBI request with an expired NCIC protection order record, issuing a standard warning not to act on it.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The document is an NCIC delayed response regarding a protection order search related to the Epstein case.
The protection order record retrieved is explicitly noted as expired.
A strong warning is issued not to search, detain, or arrest based solely on this expired record, and to contact the entering agency for confirmation.
The response is from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to the FBI New York Field Office.
The document references federal regulations (Title 28, Part 20) governing the use of NCIC information.
